parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.76

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Inventory

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Vehicle Inventory

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns all vehicle's magazines and their ammo count (also works on supply boxes). When applied to a unit (soldier), the command behaves differently and will omit magazines already loaded into unit's weapons. Use [[magazinesAmmoFull]] to return all magazines.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[magazinesAmmo]] vehicle

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] - unit or vehicle or container. When transport is supplied, the command returns vehicle's magazines not the cargo. When container is supplied, the command behaves identically to [[magazinesAmmoCargo]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] of [[Array]]s in format:
* [[String]]: magazine class name
* [[Number]]: magazine ammo count

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[magazinesAmmo]] [vehicle, includeEmpty] <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.99.146475</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] - unit or vehicle.

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> includeEmpty: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to include empty magazines

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value>  [[Array]] of [[Array]]s in format:
* [[String]]: magazine class name
* [[Number]]: magazine ammo count
 
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_magazinesAmmo = [[magazinesAmmo]] [[player]];
<template lineStart="1"><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>/*
[
	["30Rnd_65x39_caseless_mag",30],
	["30Rnd_65x39_caseless_mag",30],
	["16Rnd_9x21_Mag",16],
	["SmokeShellGreen",1],
	["Chemlight_green",1],
	["HandGrenade",1]
]
<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>*/</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value><code>_magazinesAmmo = [[magazinesAmmo]] Mi_48;
<template lineStart="1"><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>/*
[
	["250Rnd_30mm_APDS_shells",250],
	["250Rnd_30mm_HE_shells",250],
	["8Rnd_LG_scalpel",8],
	["38Rnd_80mm_rockets",38]
]
<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>*/</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[magazinesAmmoFull]], [[magazinesAmmoCargo]], [[magazinesDetail]], [[magazines]], [[magazinesTurret]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 20, 2014 - 14:41 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Actium|Actium]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
When used on vehicles this will only return all magazines associated with a single turretPath (which one depends on the actual armament of the vehicle, usually the first armed turretPath or alternatively turretPath [-1]). <br>
If you want to get all turrets' magazines, use [[allTurrets]] and [[magazinesTurret]].
--[[User:Actium|Actium]] ([[User talk:Actium|talk]]) 15:41, 20 December 2014 (CET)
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
